channel.title: Zynthian : open synth platform
channel.description:
Interesting project, pointed out by someone on the lines community.... http://zynthian.org
Basically an open source platform based on PI2/3 +HIFiBerry DAC+ LCD and some knobs... then a collection of software they are integrating....
(It seems to be hackable project, i.e. i don't think you can buy one, not sure if that is in their plans or not)
Its not a modular like, Axoloti, rather a packing of a PI in a musical format, including synths/samplers etc. It could be nice to see a modified distribution you could use a PI out of the box for this kind of thing.
so far doesn't look like any big kernel changes, so not using a real-time kernel, and latency is quite high, boot up times 'ok'.
as I have a PI2 + HIFIBerry knocking around, I might give it a go... I've actually also ordered some pots to, so perhaps just need a display and I'll have 90% of the components :)
as I said, not really like Axoloti, which is provides a modular, low latency building your own synth platform.
on reflection, I think its probably more a competitor to C&G Organelle, ok Organelle has a keyboard... but mini keys are cheap... also it uses PD, but that would be pretty simple to add to this.
anyway I thought it was interesting :)

item.title: Zynthian : open synth platform
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

its configure in github for a dac+ standard or pro, but simple change to alter it to dac+ lite.
... not sure, if the rest of the software relies on the hardware volume control, which is not available on the lite.

Read full topic

item.title: Zynthian : open synth platform
item.dc:creator: @Djeremaille
item.description:
@Djeremaille wrote:

Ok, I think it's the standard RCA one.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Djeremaille wrote:

Hi!

I haven't search a lot but do you know which model of Hifiberry DAC+ is needed? Light, standard, pro?

Read full topic
